verses.roman:
ayutāyata-varṣāṇāṁ
sahasrāṇi śatāni ca
vyatīyur bhramatas tasmin
viṣṇu-māyāvṛtātmanaḥ

synonyms: ayuta—tens of thousands; ayuta—by tens of thousands; varṣāṇām—of years; sahasrāṇi—thousands; śatāni—hundreds; ca—and; vyatīyuḥ—passed by; bhramataḥ—as he wandered; tasmin—in that; viṣṇu-māyā—by the illusory energy of Lord Viṣṇu; āvṛta—covered; ātmanaḥ—his mind.
translation: Countless millions of years passed as Mārkaṇḍeya wandered about in that deluge, his mind bewildered by the illusory energy of Lord Viṣṇu, the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
